Quick update on the current progressions: I built a mini turret!

![yDNnpG.gif](http://share.gifyoutube.com/yDNnpG.gif)

It's small enough to fit within the fuselage of the TBF Avenger, while still turning and staying in place. I have yet to make it jump the bearing.

This model has rotational limiters in place which currently allow 160 degrees of rotation (to avoid the cockpit), but can be adjusted to increase or decrease it's range.

Hello all! I've finally had time to really sit down and fix the OP, and I have to say, it's looking spot-on now! Check it out if you didn't see it on the way in! Along with that, I've added two new craft - the Curtiss P-36 Hawk, Mitsubishi A6M Zero, and the long awaited Supermarine Spitfire. Keep in mind the Spitfire might get rebuilt, or at least changed, because it's flight characteristics aren't quite right at the current time. Next craft postings will be the P-38 Lightning, Grumman Avenger (Needs work on the turret), and possibly the PBY Catalina, if I can fix the landing drag problems. Enjoy!

**Curtiss P-36 Hawk**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/oqPSF/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

The Curtiss P-36 was an American-built fighter that was on the forefront of a new wave of combat aircraft - with a mostly metal monoplane design and a powerful radial engine. This replica is my favorite of those I’ve built, both in terms of flight characteristics and the clean lines.

Parts: 158

Mass: 8.0 tons

Cost: ![fUODmlmqzcJ4GkH3Sl4W6-2921Sx_gQW0PbVOSWk_75Tyr2BKeo5CziqgqB0YeuClR4UtTXuK4l5CxA3OHCu-jxhmDgMShrzm7OLHqW6itfwnltLGa4bWN1JfnxT4go3By_a2Fg](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/fUODmlmqzcJ4GkH3Sl4W6-2921Sx_gQW0PbVOSWk_75Tyr2BKeo5CziqgqB0YeuClR4UtTXuK4l5CxA3OHCu-jxhmDgMShrzm7OLHqW6itfwnltLGa4bWN1JfnxT4go3By_a2Fg)75770

Top Speed: 130 m/s

BDArmory version: Two wing mounted cannons

**Supermarine Spitfire**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/CJTYT/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

While not the most numerous RAF fighter plane in the war, the Spitfire is arguably the most famous - Considered by some to be the quintessential British fighter. This replica, like the actual aircraft, has very sensitive elevator control.

Parts: 146

Mass: 6.9 tons

Cost: ![fUODmlmqzcJ4GkH3Sl4W6-2921Sx_gQW0PbVOSWk_75Tyr2BKeo5CziqgqB0YeuClR4UtTXuK4l5CxA3OHCu-jxhmDgMShrzm7OLHqW6itfwnltLGa4bWN1JfnxT4go3By_a2Fg](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/fUODmlmqzcJ4GkH3Sl4W6-2921Sx_gQW0PbVOSWk_75Tyr2BKeo5CziqgqB0YeuClR4UtTXuK4l5CxA3OHCu-jxhmDgMShrzm7OLHqW6itfwnltLGa4bWN1JfnxT4go3By_a2Fg)143208

**Mitsubishi A6M Zero**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/2o8mx/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

The Mitsubishi Zero was a Japanese long range fighter plane, that was widely known in the early war period as the most capable carrier-based fighter. This was primarily due to its long range and excellent maneuverability. Includes a fuel drop-pod and a tailhook for carrier landings.

Mass: 9.2 tons
